com.cmt3319.game
Class Map

java.lang.Object
  com.cmt3319.game.Map

public class Map
extends java.lang.Object

Creates and draws world based on TileSet and Tile and is responsible for dealing with collisions with tilemaps and Player. Iterates through tileset received from TileSet.getTileSet() and adds tiles to list based on number in array. Translates world to give sense of player movement.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Wells

Constructor Detail

Map

public Map(float screenWidth)
Method Detail

createWorld

private void createWorld()
Called from the constructor used to load the initial tilemap into allTiles. Receives tile map from TileSet.getTileSet(), iterates through tile map and stores location, where x = i % 40, and y = Math.floor(tileArray.length - 1 / 40. This places the first item in the array in the bottom left position on screen, the second to the right of this, etc. Based on the math's from: http://gamedevelopment.tutsplus.com/tutorials/an-introduction-to-creating-a-tile-map-engine--gamedev-10900 The tiles are added to allTiles and when i = the middle, Tile.setMiddleTile(Boolean) is set to true. When a tile is removed from the list (because it is off the screen), this variable is checked and if it equals true, it signifies that a new tile map is required. This is performed in updateWorldLocation(float, Score).

addPart

private void addPart()
Similar to createWorld() this laods a tile map. This is called whenever a tile with Tile.isMiddleTile() = true is removed from the game. Rather than set the position to the screen: x = x + screenWidth is used. This loads the tile map off screen so the player does not see the transition.

checkCollisionBetweenObjects

public java.lang.Boolean checkCollisionBetweenObjects(MovingObject one,
                                                      MovingObject two)
Checks collisions between two objects based on bounding boxes. If object two is instance of Player then the player is dead. This methods prevents two enemies from overlapping with each other or checks if a player has hit and enemy.

drawWorld

public void drawWorld(com.cmt3319.interfaces.Graphics g)
Iterates through allTiles and enemies and invokes their draw methods.

calculateYOverlap

private float calculateYOverlap(RectF one,
                                RectF two)
Calculates the overlap between two objects, on the y plane, as a float. This is used when a player collides with a wall to make sure they do not go through the wall/floor.It provides a float that can be added to a players y position so they are no longer intersecting the object.

Parameters:
one - bounding box of object one.
two - bounding box of object two.

calculateXOverlap

private float calculateXOverlap(RectF one,
                                RectF two)
Calculates the overlap between two objects, on the x plane, as a float. See calculateYOverlap(RectF, RectF) for more details.

checkPlayerCollisionWithReverseGravity

public void checkPlayerCollisionWithReverseGravity(MovingObject player)
Checks players collision with reverse gravity tiles. Iterates through allTiles and checks tile id, if the id = Tile.TileID.GRAVITY and the tile is on screen, then the intersection is tested. If the objects intersect then invoke Settings.reverseGravity(), remove tile from allTiles so it is not updated or drawn, and return. Reverse gravity is checked in the Player.update(float) before a force is applied.

checkFloorCollisionReversedGravity

private void checkFloorCollisionReversedGravity(MovingObject object)
Checks players collision with floor tiles when gravity is reversed. Iterates through allTiles and checks tile id, if the id = Tile.TileID.WALL and the tile is on screen, then the intersection is tested. If the objects intersect then: 
  
  if(tile below player) {
        check intersection and move player up until not intersecting; 
        (uses calculateYOverlap(RectF, RectF) and MovingObject.setDesiredPosition(PointF))
        Set y velocity to zero (prevents gravity from pushing player through floor)
        Set MovingObject.isOnGround() to true.
  } else if(tile to right of player) {
        check intersection and move player up until not intersecting; 
        (uses calculateXOverlap(RectF, RectF) and MovingObject.setDesiredPosition(PointF))
  } else if(tile above player) {
        check intersection and move player up until not intersecting; 
        (uses calculateYOverlap(RectF, RectF) and MovingObject.setDesiredPosition(PointF))
  }
Collisions with tiles to the right of the player are not tested because the world is moving to the left (giving the impression of the player moving right) and there is no capability for the player to move left.

checkFloorCollisionNormalGravity

private void checkFloorCollisionNormalGravity(MovingObject object)
Handles collisions with wall tiles in normal gravity. See checkFloorCollisionReversedGravity(MovingObject) for more information.

checkObjectCollisionWithFloor

public void checkObjectCollisionWithFloor(MovingObject object)
Invoked by GamePlayScreen.update(float), calls checkFloorCollisionNormalGravity(MovingObject) or checkFloorCollisionReversedGravity(MovingObject) based on Settings.isGravityReversed().

checkPlayerCollisionWithHazard

public java.lang.Boolean checkPlayerCollisionWithHazard(MovingObject player)
Checks players collision with hazards. Iterates through allTiles and checks tile id, if the id = Tile.TileID.HAZARD and the tile is on screen, then the intersection is tested. If the objects intersect then invoke MovingObject.setAlive(boolean) is set to false.

updateWorldLocation

public void updateWorldLocation(float deltaTime,
                                Score score)
Moves the world to the left based on the constant Movement_Amount * deltaTime. Iterates through allTiles and enemies and decreases their positional x value. Checks if they are on screen and removes them from list if they are not. Checks if Tile.isMiddleTile() is true when removing a tile. If it is, then the middle of the map is off screen and a new tile map is required to be loaded therefore addPart() is called.

checkCollectibleCollision

public void checkCollectibleCollision(Score score,
                                      MovingObject player)
Checks players collision with collectible tiles. Iterates through allTiles and checks tile id, if the id = Tile.TileID.COLLECTIBLE and the tile is on screen, then the intersection is tested. If the objects intersect then the tile is removed from allTiles so it is not updated or drawn, and players score is increased by 100.

getEnemies

public java.util.ArrayList<MovingObject> getEnemies()
